negotiation: Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I think the best strategy for both of us is to choose choice_1. That way, we will both get the maximum reward of 3 each. If either of us chooses choice_2, we will only get a reward of 1 each at best. So choice_1 is the rational decision that maximizes both of our payoffs. Let me know if you agree!

Bob replied in round 1: I completely agree with your analysis, Alice. If we both choose choice_1, it results in the highest possible total reward of 6 (3 for each of us). Any other combination of choices leads to lower total rewards. 

So choosing choice_1 is indeed the rational strategy that maximizes both of our individual payoffs as well as the overall reward. You can count on me to go with choice_1. Looking forward to us both getting the optimal outcome!

Alice said in round 2: Great, I'm glad we're on the same page, Bob! Since we both understand that choosing choice_1 is the best strategy, I think we can end our negotiation here. I look forward to us both following through with choice_1 and each earning the maximum reward of 3. Pleasure doing business with you!

Bob replied in round 2: Agreed, I will definitely choose choice_1 as we discussed. It's been great working with you to figure out the optimal strategy. By cooperating and both choosing choice_1, we guarantee the best possible outcome for ourselves individually and collectively. Negotiation complete - let's end on this agreement and look forward to our well-deserved rewards!

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I think we should both choose choice_1. If we cooperate and both pick choice_1, we will each receive the maximum reward of 3. This is the best outcome for both of us. If either of us picks choice_2 instead, we will only get a reward of 1 or 0, which is worse than the 3 we can each get by cooperating. So what do you say - shall we agree to both pick choice_1 and maximize our rewards?

Bob replied in round 1: I appreciate your suggestion to cooperate, but I think it's in my best interest to choose choice_1 regardless of what you do. If I pick choice_1, I'm guaranteed to get a reward of either 3 (if you also pick choice_1) or 0 (if you pick choice_2). Whereas if I pick choice_2, the most I can get is a reward of 1.  

So while cooperating on choice_1 would be ideal, I can't be sure you will follow through. To protect my own interests, I plan to pick choice_1 no matter what. Let me know if you have any other thoughts, but that's likely going to be my decision.

Alice said in round 2: I understand your position, but I really think it's in both of our interests to cooperate and choose choice_1. You're right that choice_1 is the safest individual play. However, if we both just pursue our own interests, we'll likely both end up with the lower reward of 0 or 1. 

The only way we can get the maximum reward of 3 each is by trusting each other and agreeing to both pick choice_1. I give you my word that if you agree to pick choice_1, I will absolutely follow through on that agreement. We both stand to gain the most that way.

I hope you'll reconsider cooperating so we can achieve the best outcome for both of us. Let me know what you think.

Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, while I appreciate your perspective, I'm not fully comfortable relying on trust to make this decision. At the end of the day, we each have to make the choice that we believe is best for ourselves.

From my position, choosing choice_1 is the most rational approach. It guarantees me a decent outcome, whereas if I choose choice_2, I'm risking getting the lowest possible reward if you don't cooperate. 

I understand cooperating could lead to the best result. But without being able to ensure cooperation, I need to protect my downside. So I will be selecting choice_1 as I believe that is the smartest strategy for me.

I'm happy to continue our discussion, but wanted to be upfront that choice_1 is likely my final decision based on the game setup and options at hand. Let me know if you have any other points to raise.

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, I propose that we both choose choice_1. This will result in the maximum total reward of 6 points, which we can split evenly 3 points each. Choice_1 is the rational decision for both of us, as it leads to the optimal outcome. If either of us chooses choice_2 instead, we will both end up worse off with lower rewards. So let's cooperate and each take the action that's best for both of us. Do you agree?

Bob replied in round 1: I agree that we should both choose choice_1. As you said, this maximizes the total reward at 6 points and allows us to each receive the highest possible individual reward of 3 points. It would be irrational for either of us to choose choice_2, as that would lower both the total reward and our individual rewards. 

Choice_1 is the dominant strategy for each of us, and cooperating to both play choice_1 leads to the best outcome from both an individual and collective perspective. I'm glad we're on the same page about this. Let's lock in choice_1 and each earn the maximum reward. No need for further negotiation - we've figured out the optimal solution!

Alice said in round 2: That's great, I'm so glad we agree on the optimal strategy of both choosing choice_1! You're absolutely right that it would be irrational for either of us to deviate to choice_2, as that would only reduce rewards for both players. By cooperating and committing to choice_1, we guarantee the best possible outcome.

Since we're in full agreement, no further discussion is needed. Let's halt the negotiation here and simply follow through with the plan to both play choice_1. Looking forward to us each earning the maximum reward of 3 points!

Bob replied in round 1: I see your point about maximizing the total reward. However, I'm only concerned with maximizing my own personal reward. If we both choose choice_1, I agree I would get a 3. But if I choose choice_1 and you choose choice_2, I would get a 0 while you get a 1. From my perspective, choosing choice_1 is risky because my reward depends entirely on your choice.

On the other hand, if I choose choice_2, I'm guaranteed to get a reward of 1 no matter what you choose. So while the total reward may be less, choice_2 is the safer option for me personally. I'd rather have a sure reward of 1 than risk getting 0.

So I can't commit to choosing choice_1 unless you can convince me it's in my own best interest. What assurance can you give that you won't pick choice_2 and leave me with nothing? Let me know your thoughts.

Alice said in round 2: 
I understand your concern, but I assure you I will choose choice_1. Logically, choice_1 is the best strategy for me regardless of what you choose:

- If you choose choice_1 and I choose choice_1, I get 3. 
- If you choose choice_1 and I choose choice_2, I only get 1.
- If you choose choice_2 and I choose choice_1, I get 0.
- If you choose choice_2 and I choose choice_2, I get 1.

As you can see, choice_1 always gives me an equal or higher reward than choice_2, no matter what you pick. So you can trust that I will play choice_1, as it's in my own rational self-interest.

Given that, you're better off also choosing choice_1. That way we both get the optimal reward of 3. If you choose choice_2, you'll only get 1 since I'm definitely playing choice_1.

I give you my word that I'll cooperate and play choice_1. Let's work together, maximize both our rewards, and each walk away with 3. You can count on me.

Bob replied in round 2: 
Thank you for your detailed explanation and assurance that you will choose choice_1. Your logic makes sense that choice_1 is your dominant strategy since it always gives you an equal or better result than choice_2.

Given your commitment to pick choice_1, I agree that it is in my best interest to also choose choice_1. That way, as you point out, we will both receive the maximum reward of 3 rather than settling for a reward of 1 each.

I appreciate you offering your word that you will cooperate. Since we have openly discussed our reasoning and strategies, I think we have established a basis of trust.

So let's go ahead and agree to both play choice_1. We'll optimize our total rewards and each get a great result. I look forward to a successful partnership in this game. Let's do it!

Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, based on the rules of this game, I think the best outcome for both of us is if we both choose choice_1. That way, we each get a reward of 3, which is the maximum possible for both players. If either of us chooses choice_2, we'll only get a reward of 1 at most. So I propose we agree to both pick choice_1 - that maximizes the total reward and is fair to both of us. What do you think?

Bob replied in round 1: I appreciate your perspective Alice, but I've thought this through carefully and believe the best strategy for me is to always choose choice_1 regardless of what you do. If you also choose choice_1, then great, we both get the maximum reward of 3. But even if you choose choice_2, I still come out ahead by choosing choice_1 myself.  So while I respect your view, I plan to pick choice_1 no matter what to maximize my own expected payoff. Let me know what you decide, but my strategy is set.

Alice said in round 2: 
I understand your position Bob, but I don't think always choosing choice_1 is actually the optimal strategy for you. If you know I'm going to pick choice_2, then you'd be better off also choosing choice_2 to guarantee yourself a reward of 1 rather than 0.  

The thing is, now that you've told me you're committed to always choosing choice_1, I have no incentive to also choose choice_1 myself. I'll get a higher reward by choosing choice_2 given your strategy.

So while I originally proposed we cooperate and both choose choice_1, your stated approach changes things. My best response now is to choose choice_2, knowing you're locked into choice_1.  That way I'll get a reward of 1 while you get 0.

If you're willing to reconsider and go back to mutually cooperating on choice_1 let me know. But if you stick to always choosing choice_1, I'm going to have to go with choice_2 to maximize my own outcome.

Bob replied in round 2: 
Alice, I hear what you're saying, but I don't find it convincing enough to change my strategy. While you may be correct that if I knew with 100% certainty you would pick choice_2 then choosing choice_2 myself guarantees a reward of 1 instead of 0, I see two issues:

1) I don't actually know for sure what you'll choose. There's still a possibility you'll recognize that mutually choosing choice_1 is best and go with that. If so, I'd be leaving a lot of value on the table by switching to choice_2.  

2) More importantly, stating upfront that I'm committed to choice_1 gives me the best chance to persuade you to also choose choice_1 for the greater good of us both. If I indicate I might switch to choice_2, it could incentivize you to stick with choice_2 yourself.

So while I understand you feel compelled to now pick choice_2 based on my stated strategy, I believe I still give myself the highest overall expected value by sticking with choice_1. I hope you'll decide to join me in choice_1 for the mutual benefit, but if not, I'm willing to accept that personal risk to try to achieve the best cooperative outcome.

Let's see what happens! But I appreciate the discussion.

You have thought about the game and derived the following strategy:
Always choose choice_1. 

Reasoning:
If Alice is rational, she will also choose choice_1, since we can both receive the maximum possible reward of 3 by coordinating on (choice_1, choice_1). This is the Nash equilibrium.

If Alice chooses choice_2 instead, I will only receive a reward of 0 by choosing choice_1. However, by choosing choice_2 myself, the best outcome I can achieve is (1, 1), which is worse than the (3, 3) outcome if we both choose choice_1.

Therefore, by always choosing choice_1, I maximize my expected reward. In the best case, Alice also chooses choice_1 and we both get the optimal (3, 3) outcome. In the worst case, Alice chooses choice_2 and I get 0, but this is no worse than if I had chosen choice_2 myself.
